questions.name: change_type
questions.message: Select the type of change you are committing

choices.name: wip: Work in progress.
fix: A bug fix. Correlates with PATCH in SemVer.
feat: A new feature. Correlates with MINOR in SemVer.
docs: Documentation only changes.
style: Changes that do not affect the meaning of the code (white-space, formatting, missing semi-colons, etc.).
refactor: A code change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature.
perf: A code change that improves performance.
test: Adding missing or correcting existing tests.
build: Use this for ongoing work that should be tracked in the changelog.
ci: Changes to our CI configuration files and scripts (example scopes: GitHub).
chore: Maintenance. Correlates with PATCH in SemVer.

questions.name: scope
questions.message: What is the scope of this change? (class or file name): (press [enter] to skip)

choices.name: front: Changes to Svelte and the front end.
back: Changes to the back end not directly related to Strapi.
ci: CI/CD changes like GitHub Workflows etc.
github: GitHub-specific changes to CI/CD, secrets, etc.
backstop: BackstopJS-specific changes to scenarios, configuration, etc.
perf: Perf testing, configuration, and/or enhancements.
project: Configuration, CI/CD, Developer Experience, etc.
strapi: CMS changes, updates, etc.
terraform: Changes to Terraform/Infrastructure.
docker: Changes to Dockerfiles/build steps.
testing: Changes to testing utils/tests.
utils: Changes to developer scripts and utils.

questions.name: subject
questions.message: Write a short and imperative summary of the code changes: (lower case and no period)

questions.message: Provide additional contextual information about the code changes: (press [enter] to skip)
